Problem:
Consider a scenario where a function \\( z(t) = e^{tA}z_0 \\) describes the evolution of a variable vector \\( z \\) through a linear transformation system in time \\( t \\), where \\( A \\) is a constant matrix. Another function \\( w(z) = Cz \\), where \\( C \\) is also a constant matrix, applies another linear transformation at an arbitrary time.

Can we deduce the original vector \\( z_0 \\) at t = 0 after observing \\( z(T) \\) at t = T without knowing whether \\( w(z) \\) was applied?
Explanation: Observing \\( z(T) \\) alone without the knowledge of the application of \\( w(z) \\) does not provide sufficient information to uniquely determine \\( z_0 \\). The transformation \\( C \\) could have modified \\( z_0 \\) in various ways depending on its properties relative to \\( A \\), leading to different possible initial states.
